alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver; Washington (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 7:07PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in southwest Pennsylvania, Allegheny and Washington. In western Pennsylvania, Beaver. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburgh, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Shaler Township, Hampton Township, Robinson Township, Economy, O`hara Township, Bellevue, Kennedy Township, Ambridge, Wexford, West View, Stowe Township, Coraopolis, Avalon and Sewickley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
